dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Tesla again this week, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Tesla again this week, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, absolutely. The FBI is reportedly looking into their Model 3 production statements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, absolutely. The F B I is reportedly looking into their Model three production statements.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3, according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, going back to, like, early 2017, from what the Wall Street Journal is saying. They wanna know if investors were, you know, misled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, going back to, like, early twenty seventeen, from what the Wall Street Journal is saying. They wanna know if investors were, you know, misled.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is reviewing public statements by the Palo Alto, California-based company dating back to early 2017 to determine if it misled investors based on what it said regarding its ability to produce the Model 3, according to The Wall Street Journal, citing unnamed people familiar with the matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it really comes down to the Model 3 ramp-up. I mean, Elon Musk kept predicting 5,000 units a week, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it really comes down to the Model three ramp-up. I mean, Elon Musk kept predicting five thousand units a week, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companys better-than-expected quarterly profit was driven by that car, but it took half a year longer than CEO Elon Musk had predicted to reach a production pace of 5,000 Model 3s per week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He did! He said Q4 2017, then reiterated it. But, uh, they only built around 2,700 *total* last year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did! He said Q four twenty seventeen, then reiterated it. But, uh, they only built around two thousand, seven hundred total last year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Musk had said early last year that production of Model 3, currently priced from $46,000, would reach 5,000 units per week in 2017s fourth quarter, and reiterated that target in July 2017 after production of it began in Fremont, California. In fact, the company built only about 2,700 of the cars last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It took them, like, half a year longer than he said to hit that 5,000-a-week pace consistently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It took them, like, half a year longer than he said to hit that five thousand-a-week pace consistently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it took half a year longer than CEO Elon Musk had predicted to reach a production pace of 5,000 Model 3s per week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Now, Tesla, to their credit, did confirm the Department of Justice requested documents earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Now, Tesla, to their credit, did confirm the Department of Justice requested documents earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla confirmed in an e-mailed statement that earlier this year it received a voluntary request for documents from the Department of Justice about its public guidance for the Model 3 ramp and we were cooperative in responding to it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but they were quick to say, "Hey, no subpoena, no request for testimony." So, it's not a full-blown criminal case... yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but they were quick to say, Hey, no subpoena, no request for testimony. So, it's not a full-blown criminal case... yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have not received a subpoena, a request for testimony, or any other formal process, and there have been no additional document requests about this from the Department of Justice for months.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] But the report *does* say the FBI's been talking to former employees. That usually means something's up, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the report does say the F B I's been talking to former employees. That usually means something's up, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former Tesla employees have been contacted by FBI agents seeking their testimony in a criminal case, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yeah, definitely. And the investigation apparently intensified after the whole SEC settlement with Musk over those tweets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yeah, definitely. And the investigation apparently intensified after the whole S E C settlement with Musk over those tweets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The pace of activity in the investigation, which is led by the U.S. attorneys office in San Francisco, intensified after Musk and Tesla settled a dispute with the Securities and Exchange Commission stemming from his tweets in August about taking Tesla private, the report said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right, the "taking the company private" tweet storm. That cost him his chairman role and forty million bucks in fines, collectively.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right, the taking the company private tweet storm. That cost him his chairman role and forty million bucks in fines, collectively.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As part of a settlement concluded this month, Musk agreed to step down as Teslas chairman, a position he assumed long before becoming its CEO, and pay a $20 million fine to settle the matter. Tesla also must pay a further $20 million and add two independent directors to its board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so what's Tesla's defense here, I mean, on the Model 3?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so what's Tesla's defense here, I mean, on the Model three?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, they're basically saying they set, like, "truthful targets" and they were transparent about the "production hell." You know, "unforeseen difficulties."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, they're basically saying they set, like, truthful targets and they were transparent about the production hell. You know, unforeseen difficulties.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla defended its past statements, and that its philosophy has always been to set truthful targets not sandbagged targets that we would definitely exceed and not unrealistic targets that we could never meet. When we started the Model 3 production ramp, we were transparent about how difficult it would be, openly explaining that we would only be able to go as fast as our least lucky or least successful supplier and that we were entering production hell, the company said. Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, it took six months longer than expected, but they were *trying* to be ambitious?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, it took six months longer than expected, but they were trying to be ambitious?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ultimately, given difficulties that we did not foresee in this first-of-its-kind production ramp, it took us six months longer than we expected to meet our 5,000 unit per week guidance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's what they're claiming. But it's a tough line to walk when your CEO is making such definitive statements.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's what they're claiming. But it's a tough line to walk when your C E O is making such definitive statements.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. I mean, the stock surged after their earnings, but then this news hit, and, uh, it dipped a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. I mean, the stock surged after their earnings, but then this news hit, and, uh, it dipped a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla shares surged 15%, or by $42.40, to $330.90 in the days following its surprise quarterly results. The stock was down less than 1% in after-hours trading following the WSJ story.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Just another day in the life of Tesla, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Just another day in the life of Tesla, I guess.
